div.ab: zōt ud rāspīg: Anklesaria, Kotwal and Boyd.

RecitationInstruction.ab: II gwptn'] 5, 6, 15,83, 88, 672; II 100, 110, 231, 234, 677; ẏaϑā ahū vairiiō aϑā ratuš aṣ̌āt̰.cīt̰ hacā OD gywʾk. byšʾmlwtyk gwbšn' 400, 410; ẏaϑā ahū vairiiō aϑā ratuš aṣ̌āt̰.cīt̰ hacā byšʾmlwtyk gwbšn' 500, 510.

Nerangs.ab: yaϑā ahū vairiiō dō guftan ud pad harw š́iiaōϑananąm. ēsm ud bōy ī nihādag frāz ō ī ātaxš barišn
"He has to say twice the yaϑā ahū vairiiō. At each š́iiaōϑananąm he has to bring (one piece of) the deposited ēsm and bōy to the fire."

ab.ab: "Following st. 25 the two priests recite y. a. v. 2, during which the rāspī at the word "actions" (shyaothnanām) takes the set of sandalwood and frankincense (ēsm-bōy) from eastern side of the stone nearest him and offers it to the fire. This action is repeated, using the second set of sandalwood and frankincense, during the second recitation."
"While reciting š́iiaoϑnanąm of both these Ahuna Viariia, the assistant priest, putting 2 (pieces of) wood (and) incense on the ladle, punts (them) on the fire and both go on reciting together."
